thread.title: Police: USF football player fired gun on campus at dorm
thread.title_full: Police: USF football player fired gun on campus at dorm

title: Police: USF football player fired gun on campus at dorm
text:
Police: USF football player Benjamin Knox fired gun on campus at dorm; no injuries reported THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   7:53   7:53   
Organizations: 
Florida (987) 

TAMPA, Florida — Authorities say a University of South Florida football player has been arrested and accused of firing a gun on campus. 
University police say 21-year-old freshman reserve offensive lineman Benjamin Knox of DeLand fired at a dorm from a parking garage early Sunday. 
Police say they found spent shell casings on the ground and an open gun case and ammunition inside a vehicle belonging to Knox. According to police, the shots appeared to have been fired randomly. No one was injured. 
Officers say they found a gun when they arrested Knox at his dorm. He was held on $15,000 bond on charges of discharging a firearm on school property and shooting into a building. Hillsborough County jail records didn't show whether he had an attorney. 
USF has suspended Knox from team activities.
